name: Yezza
headline: Storefronts on WhatsApp in Southeast Asia
description:
Yezza makes it easy for small businesses in SE Asia to create storefronts on WhatsApp. Our MRR is $40K with $3M monthly GMV, from 1500 orders every day. We are profitable.

Not only for selling goods & products, Yezza also built features to fit with many use cases in WhatsApp Commerce. For example, social media influencers use Yezza to deal with brands using WhatsApp. We found that customers also make table reservations through WhatsApp.

Merchants pay us $12 per month & up to $0.25 per order. With 50M WhatsApp Business downloads in SE Asia, this creates a $7.2B market opportunity. Interestingly, a similar buying-via-WhatsApp behavior exists in Latin America & Africa.

Previously, we bootstrapped a tech-enabled travel company to $12M in annual revenue, by selling travel packages using WhatsApp. We built & used this product for 4 years in our previous company. During COVID19, we offshoot it to become a standalone business called Yezza.

Yezza is now backed by Y Combinator & angel who worked at Facebook/WhatsApp.

founders.name: Ammar Roslizar, Founder
founders.description:
CEO of Yezza.

I'm building Yezza, a tech startup to help entrepreneurs earn money & save time.

founders.name: Wan Aizuddin, Founder
founders.description: CTO and Cofounder at Yezza | Loves coding and learning from others | Currently Mind-blown by Web 3.0

generated_description:
Yezza is a dynamic startup founded in 2020, headquartered in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, with a straightforward mission: to create storefronts on WhatsApp for small businesses across Southeast Asia. Backed by Y Combinator and a team with a solid tech background—including people who’ve worked at Facebook and WhatsApp—Yezza is carving its niche in a market that's ripe for innovation.

As of now, Yezza boasts an impressive monthly recurring revenue of $40K, driven by around $3 million in monthly gross merchandise volume (GMV) from approximately 1,500 daily orders. The business is not just financially healthy; it’s profitable—a rare feat for startups today. Merchants pay a modest subscription fee of $12 per month, plus a fee of up to $0.25 per order. Considering the 50 million downloads of WhatsApp Business in the region, Yezza believes it’s operating within a staggering $7.2 billion market opportunity.

The platform began by allowing small businesses to sell goods, but it's expanded to suit various use cases in WhatsApp Commerce. For instance, social media influencers now leverage Yezza to negotiate deals with brands, while customers make reservations at restaurants—all through WhatsApp.

Yezza’s scalability is evident; its initial team had prior success in building a travel tech company that generated $12M in annual revenue, which they pivoted from during the pandemic to develop Yezza. This foundational experience gives them an edge in understanding customer needs and navigating the digital marketplace effectively.

In terms of product features, Yezza is rich. It includes essential tools for clinic management—appointments, billing, inventory management—while helping a spectrum of businesses, from cafes to clinics, to streamline their operations.

The ethos of Yezza revolves around being user-friendly, automating processes to enhance efficiency, and ensuring fast customer support. They release new features every couple of weeks, showing a commitment to evolving with their user base.

In short, if you're a small business in Southeast Asia looking to tap into the WhatsApp revolution, Yezza is not just a tool; it’s a partner. Check out their offerings at [Yezza.com](https://yezza.com).
